entry.et: Middle English, from Old English meltan; akin to Old Norse melta to digest, Greek meldein to melt mollify

def.dt: :to become altered from a solid to a liquid state usually by heat
:dissolve disintegrate the sugar melted in the coffee
:to disappear as if by dissolving her anger melted at his kind words
:to become subdued or crushed (as by sorrow)
:to reduce from a solid to a liquid state usually by heat
:the mass melted at a single operation or the quantity melted during a specified period
:the action or process of melting or the period during which it occurs the spring melt
:a sandwich with melted cheese a tuna melt

entry.et: Middle English milte, from Old English; akin to Old High German miltzi spleen

def.dt: :spleen of slaughtered animals for use as feed or food

entry.et: probably from Middle Dutch milte milt of fish, spleen; akin to Old English milte spleen melt

def.dt: :the sperm-containing fluid of a male fish
:a fast-drying nonvolatile adhesive applied hot in the molten state
